In Basel, you can purchase public transportation tickets in several ways, including at ticket machines at tram and bus stops, ticket offices, or online. Many ticket machines accept both cash and credit cards.

If you prefer to buy tickets online, you can do so by visiting the website of the local transportation company, BVB (Basler Verkehrs-Betriebe). You can buy single tickets, day passes, and other types of tickets directly from the website, and you'll receive your ticket by email or as a download link. 

You can also buy transportation tickets at ticket offices, which are located at major tram and train stations such as Basel SBB, Basel Badischer Bahnhof, and Basel St. Johann. Here, you can purchase tickets for all modes of transportation, as well as pick up a printed timetable, grab a map of the transportation network, and get information on any service disruptions or route changes.

Overall, purchasing public transportation tickets in Basel is quite straightforward, with multiple options available to suit your needs. The ticket machines and ticket offices usually have instructions in multiple languages, making it easy for travelers to navigate the system even if they don't speak German.
